intro: Amsinckia davyi, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has hairy, narrow leaves and is adapted to arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. Amsinckia davyi is often found in sandy or rocky soils in desert and semi-desert regions.
